lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Piggy_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Piggy.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Piggy.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I oink for you?
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Piggy is a chat bot that can manage a list of tasks for you.
- Mark task as done or not done
There are 3 types of tasks: Todo, Deadline and Event.
Todos have no deadline and only consist of a description.
Deadlines have a deadline datetime attached to them.
Events have an at datetime attached to them.
Shows a list of all tasks.
Delete the task with the corresponding `index`. The `index` can be found from the list of tasks.
Searches all the task descriptions for one that contains `keyword`.
Marks the task with the specified `index` as done.
Marks the task with the specified `index` as not done.
Views the schedule for the specified date.
* An example of a custom control using FXML. This control represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to
* represent the speaker's face and a label containing text from the speaker.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
* Exceptions for errors specific to this package.
* Creates a new DukeException with a given message.
* @param message The message for the exception.
* @return A string with "☹ OOPS!!! " followed by the error message.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
private final Piggy piggy = new Piggy();
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Class that contains methods to help with parsing user commands.
* Parses a given command and prints the appropriate responses.
* @param ui The ui to use for displaying the responses.
* @param taskList A list of existing tasks.
static String parse(String command, Ui ui, TaskList taskList) {
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("A deadline must contain a /by");
throw new DukeException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("An event must contain an /at");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* The main class for the Piggy application.
* Creates a new Piggy application that reads and writes to a file
* You should have your own function to generate a response to user input. Replace this stub with your completed
* Class that handles storing and retrieving task data from the disk.
* Creates a new Storage object for the given file path.
* @param path The path to the file to read/write to (does not have to exist)
* Returns a list of tasks read from the data file.
* Writes the tasks to the disk inside the data file. Overrides any existing content in the file.
* @param tasks The TaskList to write to disk.
* Creates a new TaskList from a List of Tasks.
* @param index The 0-based index of the task to remove.
* Returns the task at the given index
* @param index The index to get the task from.
* Returns an Iterator over the tasks.
* Returns a List of the Tasks.
* Returns a list of tasks whose description contains the keyword.
* @return The list of tasks that match.
return "Hello! I'm Piggy\n" + "What can I oink for you?\n" + "Use the following format for datetime: " +
* Gets the bye message to be shown upon exiting.
return "Bye. Hope to oink you again soon!";
* Gets a message showing the list of tasks on the output.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to show.
return "Here are the tasks in your list:\n" + getTasks(tasks);
* Get a message showing a task has been added along with the remaining tasks.
* @param task The added task to show.
* @param noRemainingTasks The number of remaining tasks.
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + "  " + task + "\n" + "Now you have " + noRemainingTasks + " " +
* Gets a message that a task has been removed along with the remaining tasks.
* @param task The removed task to show.
* @param noRemainingTasks The number of remaining tasks.
return "Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + "  " + task + "Now you have " + noRemainingTasks + " tasks in" +
* Gets a message that a task has been marked as done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as done.
* @return The message that the task has been marked as done.
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + task;
* Gets a message that a task has been marked as not done.
* @param task The task that has been marked as not done.
* @return The message that the task has been marked as not done.
return "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + task;
* Get the list of tasks found.
sb.append("No matching tasks found in your list.\n");
sb.append("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Get the schedule of a task list.
* @param tasks The list of tasks due on the date sorted in chronological order
* @param date The date for the schedule.
return "Here are the tasks scheduled for " + date.toString() + "\n" + getTasks(tasks);
* A Task made for deadlines that can store a deadline.
* Creates a new Deadline with the given description and deadline. The Deadline is marked as not done by default.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the deadline.
* Returns a String representation of the Deadline.
* @return A String of the format "[D][<X or ' '>] <description> (by: <deadline>)".
* A Task made for events that can store the event's date.
* Creates a new Event with the given description and datetime. The Event is marked as not done by default.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param by The datetime of the event.
* Returns a String representation of the Event.
* @return A String of the format "[E][<X or ' '>] <description> (at: <datetime>)".
* Contains information for a task and allows for marking whether it is done.
* Creates a new Task with the given description. The task is marked as not done by default.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns a status icon based on whether the task is done.
* @return The {@link String} "X" if done, and " " otherwise.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the Task as not done.
* Returns the description of the Task.
* Sets the current description of the Task
* @param description The new description to be set.
* Returns whether the Task is done.
* @return true if done, and false otherwise
* Returns a String representation of the Task.
* @return A String of the format "[<X or ' '>] <description>"
* A Task that also stores an associated DateTime.
* The DateTimeFormatter used for input into this class
public static final DateTimeFormatter inDateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm");
* The DateTimeFormatter used for output from this class
public static final DateTimeFormatter outDateTimeFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
* Creates a new TaskWithDate with the given description and datetime.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param datetime A datetime with format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm".
* Returns the formatted datetime of this task.
* @return The datetime with format "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm".
* Returns a LocalDateTime object from this task's datetime.

* Creates a new Todo with the given description. The Todo is marked as not done by default.
* @param description The description of the todo.
* Returns a String representation of the Todo.
* @return A String of the format "[T][<X or ' '>] <description>"
